channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump taps Kevin Warsh to lead the Federal Reserve
item.description: Trump plans to nominate Kevin Warsh to be the next chair of the Federal Reserve, when Jerome Powell's term expires in May. The president has been pushing the central bank to slash interest rates.
item.content:encoded:
Trump plans to nominate Kevin Warsh to be the next chair of the Federal Reserve, when Jerome Powell's term expires in May. The president has been pushing the central bank to slash interest rates.

(Image credit: Alastair Grant)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Sen. Richard Blumenthal, D-Conn., talks about efforts to avert a partial shutdown
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Sen. Richard Blumenthal, D-Conn., ahead of a possible partial government shutdown Friday.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Sen. Richard Blumenthal, D-Conn., ahead of a possible partial government shutdown Friday.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Winter storm causes weather phenomenon known as 'frost quakes' in parts of the South
item.description: Last weekend's winter storm dumped snow and ice across the South, but some people also experienced loud booms and felt their homes shake because of a weather phenomenon called "frost quake."
item.content:encoded: Last weekend's winter storm dumped snow and ice across the South, but some people also experienced loud booms and felt their homes shake because of a weather phenomenon called "frost quake."
item.dc:creator: Lisa Autry

item.title: For U.S. figure skating, grief over the D.C. crash makes for a bittersweet Olympics
item.description: In the wake of the Jan. 2025 plane crash, some young skaters weren't sure they could continue. A year later, many have found that's the best way to honor those they lost.
item.content:encoded:
In the wake of the Jan. 2025 plane crash, some young skaters weren't sure they could continue. A year later, many have found that's the best way to honor those they lost.

(Image credit: Tyrone Turner for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Senate scrambles to keep funding flowing and avert partial shutdown, border czar says he may withdraw some immigration agents from Minnesota, FBI seizes 2020 ballots from Fulton County, Georgia.
item.content:encoded: Senate scrambles to keep funding flowing and avert partial shutdown, border czar says he may withdraw some immigration agents from Minnesota, FBI seizes 2020 ballots from Fulton County, Georgia.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Minnesota-based rapper talks about being detained by federal troops at protest site
item.description: A Minnesota-based rapper who performs as Nur-D shares what it was like to be tackled and detained by federal troops at a protest site in Minneapolis on Saturday.
item.content:encoded: A Minnesota-based rapper who performs as Nur-D shares what it was like to be tackled and detained by federal troops at a protest site in Minneapolis on Saturday.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: The dollar's value has been falling. Who benefits and who loses from a weak dollar?
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep asks David Wessel of Brookings who wins and loses from the weak dollar.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep asks David Wessel of Brookings who wins and loses from the weak dollar.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Efforts to extend ACA subsidies stall in Congress as GOP reignites old arguments
item.description: Efforts to pass extra financial help for people who buy their own health insurance have sputtered in Congress, and Republicans are dusting off arguments against Obamacare that they've used for years.
item.content:encoded: Efforts to pass extra financial help for people who buy their own health insurance have sputtered in Congress, and Republicans are dusting off arguments against Obamacare that they've used for years.
item.dc:creator: Selena Simmons-Duffin

item.title: Trump's military interventions concern China despite there being no direct risk
item.description: China is troubled by President Trump's military interventions and threats of regime change around the world, even if they don't necessarily pose a direct threat to China.
item.content:encoded: China is troubled by President Trump's military interventions and threats of regime change around the world, even if they don't necessarily pose a direct threat to China.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Kuhn

item.title: FBI seizes thousands of 2020 ballots from Fulton County, Georgia
item.description: The FBI seized thousands of ballots from the 2020 election in Fulton County, Georgia, raising concerns among state and local election officials about what this could mean for the midterm elections.
item.content:encoded: The FBI seized thousands of ballots from the 2020 election in Fulton County, Georgia, raising concerns among state and local election officials about what this could mean for the midterm elections.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler
